required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Changes in Habitual Physical Activity and Inactivity
clinical_study.official_title: Changes in Physical Activity and Inactivity During a 12-week Exercise Training and/or Sedentary Time Intervention

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if individuals involved in exercise training change habitual activity and inactivity behavior outside of exercise training. Eligible participants were randomly assigned to one of four groups: control, exercise training, sedentary time reduction, or exercise training plus sedentary time reduction. It was hypothesized that participants in the exercise training group will compensate for exercise training by reducing free-living physical activity behavior and increasing sedentary time. Participant free-living behavior was monitored for one week at baseline, 3, 6, 9 and 12 weeks using an activPAL wearable monitor.

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in sedentary time at 3 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Measure is based on data collected with a wearable monitor that assesses time spent sitting/lying, standing, and walking

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in sedentary time at 6 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Measure is based on data collected with a wearable monitor that assesses time spent sitting/lying, standing, and walking

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in sedentary time at 9 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Measure is based on data collected with a wearable monitor that assesses time spent sitting/lying, standing, and walking

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in sedentary time at 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Measure is based on data collected with a wearable monitor that assesses time spent sitting/lying, standing, and walking

secondary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in physical activity at 3 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: wearable monitor (activPAL) assesses number of steps, MVPA

secondary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in physical activity at 6 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: wearable monitor (activPAL) assesses number of steps, MVPA

secondary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in physical activity at 9 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: wearable monitor (activPAL) assesses number of steps, MVPA

secondary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in physical activity at 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: wearable monitor (activPAL) assesses number of steps, MVPA

arm_group.description: Group had outcome measures collected and were instructed to not change activity and sedentary time behavior
Participants performed 5 days per week, 40 min per session of exercise training under direct supervision of personal trainer.
participants were give strategies to reduce sedentary time
Participants completed exercise training (5 days per week, 40 min per session) plus were given sedentary time reduction intervention

intervention.description: 12 weeks, 5 days of week, 40 min per session of exercise training
participants provided with strategies to decrease sitting

intervention.intervention_name: exercsie training plus sedentary time reduction
intervention.description: 12 weeks of exercise training (5 days a week, 40 min per session) plus given strategies for reducing sitting time

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Eligible participants were those at increased risk of cardiovascular disease, based on meeting two of the following three criteria:
1. Pre-hypertensive: resting blood pressure between 125-160 mm Hg systolic and/or 85-100 mm Hg diastolic,
2. overweight/obese: body mass index (BMI) between 25 and 45 kg∙m-2,
3. high central adiposity: as defined by elevated natural waist circumference (> 102 cm [males] > 88cm [females]), a surrogate measure of visceral fat
4. low aerobic fitness (VO2 peak ≤ 50th percentile of age and sex specific norms)
5. exercising less than three days per week for less than 20 minutes per session for the preceding six months
Exclusion Criteria:
- major orthopedic limitations,
- wheelchair use or musculoskeletal problems that affected mobility,
- life-threatening illness (e.g., terminal cancer),
- chronic diseases (e.g., diagnosed heart disease, diabetes, emphysema) or
- any condition for which a physician did not recommend exercise. Participants were excluded if they had gastric bypass or lap-band surgery within the last year, were taking medication for type II diabetes (e.g. metformin) or beta-blocker medication for high blood pressure.

facility.name: UMass Amherst Physical Activity and Health Lab
